p:
To interpret this expression, notice that a member of S
EF chooses the first activity pattern with probability a
EF and the second activity pattern with probability (1 − a
EF ). In the first activity pattern, a fraction
f
E F , E M
( 1 )
of contacts is with an enabled male, and a fraction
f
E F , D M
( 1 )
is with a disabled male. The probability that a contact with an enabled male, once it occurs, is with an infectious partner is the same as the fraction of enabled infectious males among all enabled males. Please note that this does not mean that the contact itself occurs with the same probability as the proportion within the population. The probability of contact is determined by the activity patterns. Finally, the probability of disease transmission in such a contact is t
EM→ EF .
